results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
About Us

Amper¬†is a rapidly-growing IoT startup that helps manufacturers unleash their potential with modern software to run operations.

We build a simple but powerful platform that helps manufacturers reduce costs, increase visibility, and drive efficiency. We believe in keeping things simple and easy-to-understand - and our culture and products are a reflection of that. For example, it takes a few minutes to self-install Amper on any kind of industrial machine - like a consumer device and without the traditional hassle of integration.

Our vision is to build the market-leading FactoryOS to enable cutting-edge operations, and we are investing in the next level of growth across our GTM and product teams. We are a venture-backed startup with a distributed team and HQ in Chicago.

About You

We‚Äôre growing our product organization and are looking for a Product Manager to help us evolve through our next stage of growth.

Being a Product Manager at Amper means working across every function; Engineering, Sales, Customer Success, Marketing. You‚Äôll work directly with customers to understand what holds them back from achieving their goals and what‚Äôs making them successful. You‚Äôll work with engineers to solve problems, sales to find new opportunities for growth, customer-facing teams to process customer feedback, etc. You‚Äôll say ‚Äúno‚Äù a lot.

You‚Äôll enjoy working at Amper if you:

  • Have a strong appetite for the unfamiliar; that includes technical content as well as solving problems our customers face

  • Believe that being helpful and humble are just as important as technical know-how

  • Can teach the things you know well, and acknowledge what you can learn from others

Requirements

  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills + experience driving influence across functions. Create Marketing and Product Requirement Docs.

  • Project Management.

  • Ready to wear many hats, frequently change contexts

  • High EQ + empathy

  • Strong problem-solving ability; recognize what you don‚Äôt know and find a path to know it

Preferences

  • Experience in the manufacturing industry

  • Previous Product Management Experience

  • Experience working in SaaS Companies

Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO, 2-week minimum

  • 401(k) plan

  • Health insurance (medical, vision, and dental)

  • Team outings, group lunches, an open office, happy hours

  • Flexible work schedule

results.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
Job Description

Okteto provides a local development experience for cloud applications. In a world of ever-emerging technologies, the number of tools to manage cloud-native applications becomes more overwhelming every year. This vastly increases the cognitive load for developers, decreases their productivity and forces them to become experts in areas different from their own. With Okteto, you code locally in your favorite IDE and Okteto takes care of updating your application in your development environment to provide continuous feedback as you code. No commit, build, push, or deploy required.

We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to help us educate users on how to get the most out of Okteto and to improve our processes. You will be the first product marketing hire and will be responsible for GTM launch process, ensuring organizational readiness, supporting sales enablement efforts, and managing projects for key deliverables.

What you'll be doing

  • Create a repeatable process for a product launch that includes all go-to-market and organizational readiness activities and deliverables

  • Project manage launches to ensure all systems are ‚Äúgo‚Äù and then monitor impact

  • Collaborate with teams to create compelling sales and marketing collateral as well as messaging and internal/external communications to drive adoption/conversion

  • Fully own the planning and execution of product marketing projects to support key Okteto partnerships and integrations

  • Write and/or coordinate the production of written and video content explaining the joint Okteto + partner value proposition

  • Partner with the product management team to distill key functionality and benefits into core product marketing messages

  • Collaborate with sales enablement team to help create training materials, making it easy for sales to understand our product offerings and key positioning

  • Identify and support industry third-party events

A good fit

  • You are comfortable async communication and working with a remote team across multiple timezones.

  • You have experience working on GTM for developer tooling.

  • You thrive on building process and programs from start to finish. Having a big impact on a growing company gets you excited.

  • You think outside the box when it comes to strategy and initiatives.

  • You are a polished content builder.

  • You are a strong public communicator and are comfortable being a company representative for things such as customer meetings, hosting webinars and public conversations, creating video content, etc.

Nice to have

  • Video production and editing skills.

  • Experience using design tools like Figma.

  • Experience within Cloud-native ecosystem

Joining Okteto

  • An opportunity to join an early startup made up of people passionate about developer experience and community building.

  • 100% remote from day one means we understand what it takes to foster an efficient, distributed team across international time zones.

  • $1000 office equipment stipend to get you set up for work-from-home productive success

  • Sponsored yearly company offsite - read about

  • Unlimited PTO with 3 weeks minimum encouraged, plus a full company week off in December.

  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Health, dental, and vision.

  • 401K

  • 16 weeks paid parental leave for birth, adoption and foster parents.

Base Salary starting at $150,000 depending on experience

results.title: Content Strategist, Developer Content
results.description:
Prismic is hiring an Editor to bring our content production to the next level.
¬†
About Prismic
¬†
We are building a tool for frontend developers to ship a custom website builder for their content team. Marketers can compose new pages for their site by mixing-and-matching website sections their developers have built for them.
Our developers have the freedom to choose their own stack to build these website sections and use our product alongside some pretty incredible technologies, including¬†Next.js,¬†Nuxt.js,¬†Gatsby.js, and more.
We've been investing a lot of time and attention into our video content, interviewing people like¬†Wes Bos,¬†Guillermo Rauch¬†(CEO of Vercel),¬†Tim Neutkens¬†(Maintainer of¬†Next.js),¬†Sebastien Chopin¬†(creator of¬†Nuxt.js),¬†Matt Biilmann¬†(CEO of Netlify), and the list goes on.
It's now time for our written content to get more attention. We are looking for an Editor who'll make our blog and site, in general, the place where developers can come to optimize everything from their careers to their tech stacks. It should be a place where developers expect to find new resources on a regular basis about a wide variety of topics, with clear and insightful reviews, and advice to help them get a better understanding of the tools that they use.
¬†
The opportunity
¬†
This is an exciting opportunity for someone who loves both words and technology. This person will have the unique opportunity to shape the broader conversation about web development and the future of digital publishing.
To be successful in this role, you must have a technical mind and a passion for content strategy. You¬†don't¬†need to know what¬†CSS selector specificity¬†is off the top of your head (for example), but you¬†do¬†need to be curious to find out and be able to edit an article on such technical topics for spelling, grammar, and flow.
¬†
The blog editor will be responsible for:
¬†
- Evolving and implementing a content strategy for the Prismic blog that includes SEO, social media, and metrics;
- Assisting with social media;
- Finding potential writers;
- Soliciting and commissioning articles for the Prismic blog from freelance writers;
- Helping Prismic team members from across the organization to contribute to the blog;
- Ensuring every piece of content published meets our standard of quality (free of grammar and spelling errors, well-written, helpful);
- Brainstorming ideas for the Prismic blog;
- Managing an editorial calendar;
- Occasionally writing and editing materials for other departments, such as marketing copy and job postings.
¬†
You're exactly what we are looking for if you...
¬†
- Have web development skills in Javascript, and be familiar with a framework such as React, Vue, or Svelte;
- Are interested in web development and web publishing;
- Have experience with building effective social media and SEO strategies;
- Have experience editing content and managing writers;
- Are excited about owning a challenging project and leading it to measurable success;
- Can describe systems you would use for management ‚Äî whether that's kanban, spreadsheets, Gantt, or something else;
- Can describe metrics of publishing success and how to track them;
- Have opinions about spelling and grammar;
- Have ideas about how to convey the tone and voice of a brand.
- Are excited to join a collaborative team of problem-solvers.
¬†
And what about the job details?
¬†
Although our headquarters are in Paris, this position is open to fully remote work. So as long as you've got a good internet connection, we don't care where you are. Whether you work from our main office in Paris, or you are a remote employee, we‚Äôll be working together a lot ‚Äì particularly, through pairing and collaborating ‚Äì and we want you to succeed!
Do you want to relocate to Paris? That's great. We're always happy to have someone new in the office, but there is no preferential treatment for candidates based on their location.
That being said, where you are based may change the offer and benefits that we can provide. We'd love to be able to give you an exhaustive list of everything that we can offer, but it's difficult until we know where you are.
Our employees in Paris benefit from healthcare, extensive paid time off, paid lunches, travel reimbursement, and a bunch of other stuff.
A key aspect of Prismic is the culture that we have developed. We have regular team gatherings, all-hands meetings where every team member can discuss any topic, and we tackle challenging problems in a collaborative way where every person‚Äôs views have value. So, no matter where you are, we will want to make you a part of that culture. You might not be able to make every team building, but we will make sure that you feel welcomed and part of a company where you can thrive and grow.
¬†
Get in touch
¬†
Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? Please apply anyway!
Prismic is devoted to building a team of people with different backgrounds and lifestyles.
We eagerly invite applications from people of all kinds. We don‚Äôt discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, citizenship, or any other differences. If we can do anything to provide a better interview (i.e. accommodate a disability) please do let us know.
¬†
With your application, please include:
¬†
A thoughtful cover letter/short paragraph explaining why you would enjoy working in this role and why you want to work at Prismic.
A resume or a short summary of your job history. (A link to a LinkedIn profile would be fine)
When we receive your complete application with the items above, we‚Äôll get back to you about the next steps.

results.title: Designer, NationSwell Studio
results.description:
Founded in 2013, NationSwell helps purpose-driven leaders and organizations take their impact to the next level. Our unique ecosystem of services and experiences provides influential leaders and organizations with essential strategy, connections, and amplification. NationSwell is a certified B Corp, which means how we do business is inextricably linked to our mission and impact. We hold ourselves accountable every day to the values of Integrity, Excellence, Inclusion, Innovation, Inspiration, and Teamwork.

The NationSwell Studio is the nation‚Äôs leading social impact studio. As part of the NationSwell ecosystem, the Studio is embedded in‚Ä® a unique community of purpose-driven leaders and experts, and we are committed to helping our partners take their impact to the next level through strategy, storytelling and audience engagement. Our sweet spot is distilling complex social issues into compelling human stories, moving influential audiences to action and centering impacted communities in all that we do. Clients include progressive corporations, leading philanthropies,and cutting edge nonprofits, such as AARP, Einhorn Collaborative, Greater Good Science Center, The Mission Continues, Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, Samsung NEXT, Schultz Family Foundation, Starbucks, TENT, and Toyota.

Role Overview
NationSwell is seeking a Designer to join the NationSwell Studio team to help create partner brand and campaign collateral design. This person will report to the Managing Director and will serve as the lead production designer for the NationSwell Studio. Qualified candidates will have a strong portfolio of visual design experience including (but not limited to) brand identity, layout, typography, web design, motion graphic content, and illustration.

As Designer, you will help design campaigns, brand identities, content and advertising campaigns, and event experiences for Studio clients, and help to shape NationSwell branded initiatives and the identity of the NationSwell visual brand.

Your work should be curious, inclusive, and brave ‚Äî striving for relevance, excellence and distinctiveness. You have a passion for design storytelling and know how to harness design to solve the complex problems that affect the human experience. You understand that great creative work requires great strategy and you always have rationales for your decisions. You have a passion for working in mission-driven fields, and you have an entrepreneurial spirit.

The annual salary range for this position is $70,000 - $90,000.

What will you do?

  • Work with many different facets of design including (but not limited to) digital/social, brand identity systems, typography, web design, motion graphics, photography, illustration
  • Use a variety of tools and techniques to create designs that not only look great, but are executed in meaningful ways to deliver quantifiable results
  • Design across a variety of styles/looks, as defined by the goals and guidelines of our clients and initiatives
  • Demonstrate an exceptional eye for layout, composition and UI
  • Work proficiently with design and prototyping tools and methods (e.g, Adobe CC, Sketch, Figma, etc.)
  • Help extract design needs from a wide variety of stakeholders, both internally and externally, in order to clearly define the deliverables, goals/objectives, milestones and successful outcomes of any given project
  • Conduct relevant research to guide the rationale behind your design decisions throughout the creative process
  • Experience in video production desirable but not required
  • Inspire your NationSwell teammates from other (non-Creative) disciplines, setting and maintaining the industry standards of creativity from concept to execution

What are you like?

  • Have a strong understanding of composition, color theory, typography, design history, and information architecture
  • Have a track record as a well-liked design leader for projects/campaigns that include design systems, audience experiences, and products that delight audiences/users and achieve business results
  • You don‚Äôt have a singular look to your work - you‚Äôre happiest as a shape-shifter who can create a unique design solution for client/project
  • Adept at guiding internal and external teams using rationales and persuasion, rather than inflexibility and impatience
  • Prioritize high teammate and client satisfaction with your design work and process
  • Display the consistent ability to clearly express yourself and have a strategic rationale for your creative ideas ‚Äî including having the confidence to present your work in a clear and inspiring way to internal teams and client partners
  • Enjoy monitoring the latest design trends from around the world in order to bring fresh inspiration to the creative team (and our wider teams) on a daily/weekly basis
  • You have a ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the note behind the note?‚Äù approach to feedback. You know that every note - whether or not you make the change - is valuable because it provides information
  • When you give feedback, you offer solutions, rather than merely identify a problem
  • A self starter who takes initiative and is not fearful of ambiguity ‚Äî offer creative ideas that the team and partners can respond to
  • Excellent organizational skills ‚Äî able to effectively manage deadlines, thinking 5 steps ahead, and prioritizing work
  • Embraces collaboration and idea sharing, open to feedback from all disciplines ‚Äî enjoys working with a small, in-house team paired with a roster of freelance specialists
  • Nice to have: experience or interest in inclusive and purpose driven design

Benefits

We know that having a positive team culture is essential to achieving our goals, so we put time and effort into making NationSwell an encouraging, energizing, and exciting place to work. We are proud to be a certified B Corp. Here are just a few of the ways we celebrate our staff and culture at NationSwell.

  • Health and Wellness: Health, dental, and vision insurance, an EAP, HSA, FSA, and other wellness benefits for you + your family
  • Family-friendly: Eight weeks of paid parental leave
  • Work-Life Balance: Unlimited paid time off and flexible schedules to encourage your work-life balance
  • Giving Back: Paid time off for employees to volunteer for causes that matter to them and internal moments to celebrate it
  • Remote Work Support: A stipend to help you set up your desired home office
  • Transit: A fully-covered Citi Bike membership and pre-tax transit benefits to help you get to where you‚Äôre going
  • Net Purpose + Culture Index: Measure of our employee‚Äôs sense of purpose and engagement with our Mission
  • Your Savings: Employees are offered a 401k account, and we match a portion of each contribution

NationSwell is committed to creating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are dedicated to building a workforce that celebrates diversity and equity and believe that inclusivity plays an important role in our decision-making process, both in staffing and in work product.

results.title: Startup Community Partnerships
results.description:
üöÄ About Pulley

Pulley's mission is to make it easier for anyone to start a company. We believe that more startups should exist and that founder-led companies are more successful in the long term. With Pulley‚Äôs cap table management tools, companies can better understand and optimize their equity for the long term. Starting a company is hard enough. Managing equity shouldn‚Äôt be.¬†

We‚Äôre a high-performing team looking for passionate, execution-focused, self-starters to help us build equity management tools for founders. Pulley is growing quickly with over 1600 customers including unicorns like Clubhouse, Birdies, Coda, and Fast - all within our first year of product launch. Our trajectory is fueled by top investors like Founder's Fund, Stripe, General Catalyst, Caffeinated Capital, 8vc, Elad Gil, among other great angels. All of our growth has been organic, and we‚Äôre growing the team to meet the demand.

¬†

üåü Who We're Looking For

The partnership team engages directly with partners that refer clients to Pulley. Our team then works directly with those referrals to help them get set up for success. This partnership role will cover a wide variety of our growing business areas, with a focus on maintaining and cultivating our accelerator partners and startup community channels. You‚Äôll be on the front lines of the company‚Äôs most critical projects and have the opportunity to evolve your role and grow with us.

¬†

üõ† Responsibilities

  • Design and implement strategies to engage with our existing accelerator partnerships (eg YCombinator) and build new relationships. You‚Äôll be in charge of driving referrals from the investor community and beyond

  • Source, structure, and negotiate deals with existing partners in pursuit of product and business objectives. From prospecting to onboarding, you‚Äôll serve as the key point person for our company along the way

  • Partner with cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Growth, Sales) to identify and implement growth opportunities.

  • You‚Äôll understand our partners‚Äô unique strategic priorities, challenges, and internal roadmaps; and can regularly communicate insights and strategic recommendations back to our teams

  • Own and manage tracking and analysis of pipeline activity to ensure on-target performance and inform strategic planning¬†

¬†

üôå Qualifications & Fit

  • 6+ years of work experience in a fast-paced, startup environment, preferably in the context of customer/vendor relationships, strategic partnerships, consulting, and/or as a founder

  • Experience with cross-functional team collaboration and ability to thrive in a dynamic and rapidly evolving working environment

  • You have strong presentation skills, particularly for in-person meetings with multiple stakeholders

  • Exceptional attention to detail. You have a strong ability to operate in the weeds without losing sight of the big picture

  • Entrepreneurial mindset and working style. You‚Äôre a self-starter who stays highly accountable, with a strong ability to anticipate problems and implement effective solutions

¬†

üíö Benefits

  • Generous health insurance

  • Unlimited vacations

  • Commuting & food

¬†

‚ú® Our Culture

TL&DR - Pulley is not a good fit for everyone, and that‚Äôs OK. This is a bit about the culture of Pulley. We need people who aren‚Äôt just interested in working at a startup; we need people who are excited about building a great company. In addition to function-specific skills, here are some traits that enable our team members to thrive:

  • Ego-less Learner -- Every day at Pulley, we are trying things that we‚Äôve never done before - sometimes they work; sometimes they don‚Äôt. To be successful here, you need to embrace that feeling of ‚Äòbeing a beginner‚Äô and be willing to accept feedback in stride.¬†

  • Less Talk; More Action -- Everyone rolls up our sleeves at Pulley. If your strength is being the ‚Äòidea gal or guy‚Äô but you don‚Äôt create your own slides or write your own code, then we are not a great fit.¬†¬†

  • Prioritize ruthlessly - Our view is that being a 10x engineer is not about writing more code; it‚Äôs about making the right decision on what to build. We‚Äôre hiring for people who can make the right strategic decisions on where to spend their time

We‚Äôre also inspired by the culture work done at other companies and plan to develop our own playbook here too. One of the concepts that resonate most with us is the importance of stunning colleagues.

If you like the sound of our environment and you‚Äôre passionate about joining a team like the one we‚Äôve described, we'd love to talk!

results.title: Software Engineer
results.description:
Company Overview
Encoura is transforming the way students connect with opportunities as they move through high school into post-secondary opportunities. Our mission is to empower students and institutions to create meaningful connections so students can make the most informed decisions to achieve their goals. Most recently, the company has evolved its product technology stack and services to better address the future path of students enabling easy connectivity to their opportunities.

Our Encoura platform provides custom technology solutions that combine Eduventures‚Äô research, data science, strategic enrolment and multichannel marketing services to over 2,000 higher ed institutions. The company also offers the Encourage‚Ñ¢ mobile app for students‚Äîthe nation‚Äôs largest free college and career planning program used by millions of high school students and educators nationwide.


Role Overview
Encoura‚Äôs success is directly a function of talent. We are serious about hiring the best talent possible in creating our crew that is incredibly passionate and dedicated to building the next-gen ecosystem of systems and products that will improve the student experience across the entire college and career planning lifecycle.

We are looking for an experienced hands-on Software Engineer to join a small, distributed team of engineers. You‚Äôll work closely with Engineering and Product Leadership as you build your craft alongside other developers in small scrum teams. You will bring a continuous improvement mentality to the role, always on the lookout for ways to make things better across the company and within your own scope of responsibility.


A day in the Life of a Software Engineer
  • Working with Engineering and Product Team leads, propel the team through agile development of web apps, mobile apps, libraries, and frameworks, connecting with graphQL microservices.
  • As a Software Engineer, you‚Äôll be very involved in the overall design of the system you‚Äôre working on while learning our existing technical stacks.
  • Collaborate within your team while attending grooming sessions and assisting others as needed to move the team forward.
  • Promote a work environment that is highly collaborative and team-centric.
  • Enhance, refactor, and continuously improve the codebase.
  • Keep management informed of project progress and problems, particularly as to needed changes in schedule, resources, or product scope.
  • Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical people.


Role Progression
  • In your 1st month, you will be learning about our business, processes, and recommended tech stack. You will immediately be working hands-on with our technology and getting to know your team.
  • Within 3 months, you will be participating in planning & development activities and beginning to look at infrastructure designs, CI/CD pipelines and carrying out code reviews for the team.
  • Within 6 months you should be taking ownership of the application architecture, production troubleshooting, working on cross-portfolio projects and releasing software with the team.
  • Within 1 year you will be fully immersed in the SDLC, providing technical assistance to your team and building bulletproof products while actively engaging in process optimization.


About you
  • You hold a BS in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or equivalent work experience. A relevant Master‚Äôs degree is a plus.
  • You have 2+ years experience building software applications understanding the full scope of the app including the front and back- end topology.
  • You have 2+ years experience working with Microsoft‚Äôs .NET stack to develop web and system applications.
  • You are experience with Docker and setting up local dev environments.
  • You have a presence on Github with your own portfolio of projects to share and demonstrate.
  • You‚Äôve worked with a technology stack similar to ours: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Linux, macOS, Windows, PostgreSQL, MS SQL Server, Redis, ElasticSearch, MongoDB, Javascript, ReactJS, NodeJS, Python, DataDog, GitHub, JIRA and Confluence.
  • You‚Äôre used to working in an iterative-based development environment using Agile/Scrum/Sprints.
  • Experience working with GraphQL (Apollo), NodeJS and preferably using a framework such as NestJS a plus.
  • Experience building web applications with React, Material UI, NextJS, and Typescript a plus.
  • You are always thinking, ‚Äúwhat happens if this fails?‚Äù
  • You are opinionated about software architecture.
  • You‚Äôre an excellent, collaborative team player with the communication skills to match.
  • You are passionate about getting the job done well even under time pressure and thrive in a demanding environment.
  • Demonstrated proactivity in capitalizing on opportunities and resolving issues.
  • Intellectually curious ‚Äì prepared to challenge and be challenged.
  • Constantly striving to learn new technologies and look for ways to stay up to date in this rapidly changing industry.


What sets us apart?
  • Mission driven culture
  • Paid holidays and generous PTO policy
  • Generous benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Life and Disability, HSA, FSA,
  • Tuition Reimbursement, and 401k
  • Casual dress
  • Collaborative and energetic work environment with other motivated, career-driven professionals

results.description:
The Company ‚Äì Clarity AI

At Clarity AI, we are committed to bringing social impact to markets. We are a tech company started in 2017, leveraging AI and machine learning technologies to ensure environmental, social and governance dimensions are the focal point of decision making within financial markets.

We are now a team of more than 180 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as BlackRock, Deutsche B√∂rse and SoftBank, who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams this year, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are looking for a Senior Manager to join our Product Research & Innovation chapter and lead our Regulation team. Your work will be shaping and guiding our regulatory offer and the investment decisions of our clients.

Position Overview

We are looking for an individual to oversee a portfolio of projects and teams working on the creation of new methodologies and features for our digital product to help our clients in the financial industry,

‚óè Comply with sustainability related regulation,

‚óè Manage the financial risk related to sustainability factors of their investment portfolios

‚óè Measure the environmental and social impact of their investment portfolios.

This position focuses on methodologies related to Regulatory Products. The Senior Manager will be required to set Clarity‚Äôs strategic vision on methodologies and models for regulatory compliance. The scope of work will cover a broad range of standards, such as the EU Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation (SFDR), existing and upcoming green and social taxonomies (e.g., EU Taxonomy, UK Taxonomy), or the integration of client preferences on sustainability under Markets in Financial Instruments Regulation (MiFID II).

LOCATION: This role is based in Europe, US or Remote

Key Responsibilities

The Senior Manager will be responsible for defining and leading Clarity‚Äôs work on methodologies to help financial market participants comply with sustainability related regulation. The role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:

‚óè Contribute to Clarity‚Äôs strategic agenda on Regulatory Products.
